## Interacting with Apps

### Selecting an Application

- Each "window" in SAGE is called an application or "app". You can click on the app and it will get bordered by a teal color. This means you are interacting with it.

![](images/interacting.png){fig-align="center" width="800px"}

### Changing Position of an Application

- To move an app from its original position, unselect the app by clicking on a blank space, and drag the mouse to the app (Notice the pointer changes). Then, simply click, hold and drag.

![](images/dragging.png){fig-align="center" width="800px"}

## Enter and Exit Focus Mode

- One can fit an application to the entire screen. To do this, select the application. Next, select "Focus Mode"

![](images/focusmode.png){fig-align="center" width="800px"}

- Simply click on "Exit" to exit focus mode.

![](images/exitfocusmode.png){fig-align="center" width="800px"}

## Interacting with PDFs

With a PDF, you can do several things. Some of them are listed below.

### Display Multiple Pages

- Click on the PDF, and you will see the PDF viewer as shown above.
- Use the "+" sign to add pages to be displayed.

![](images/addpages.png){fig-align="center" width="800px"}

### Reduce Number of Pages Displayed

- Click on the PDF, and you will see the PDF viewer
- Use the "-" sign to reduce the number of pages to be displayed.

![](images/removepage.png){fig-align="center" width="800px"}
